page.title: 14SHOP PRICES 14thJUNE 1985.
page.content: {Dresses}Womens summer clothing.Most summer dresses were made out of cotton or polyester mixture. A summer dress could be bought for around Â£10.00. Blouses averaged Â£12.00 and were mostly made of cotton. {Shoes -Food }Adults shoes men averaged Â£20.00 .Prawns were the most expensive sea food on sale. {Mens - Boys -Clothing }Mens clothing is made largely from synthetic materials like polyester ,nylon or mixed with cotton and wool.Average prices for men's clothing:- suit Â£70.00, pullovers Â£11.00-Â£16.00 (wool more expensive) trousers Â£12.00- Â£20.00 shirts ranged from Â£8.00-Â£11.00 (medium priced retail outlet). boys jeans aged 5-6; 11 years old Â£10.99, boys shorts Â£5.50 boys shirts Â£5.99. {Annette Mayor.
